Description: Miniature wheelmade pottery lethykos in Nile silt. Pot has a circular foot, convex body, short neck with everted and collared rim and one handle. The exterior is lightly covered with a red-brown slip, and the rim is chipped. These are abundant in the Meroitic period and this example is likely imported from Egypt.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 58) (Type M7)
